definition: to look after/to take into consideration/to attend to

sentences.english: When you ride in the street you must look about(you) lest you bump into someone.
sentences.chinese: 在街上骑车，你必须留神四顾，免得撞着别人。

sentences.english: To get a good mortgage deal and terms it would be wise to look around the internet.
sentences.chinese: 取得了良好的条件和抵押协议是明智之举四顾互联网。

sentences.english: Look around wonder why we can live a life that's never satisfied.
sentences.chinese: 茫然四顾，为何能忍受，这从未满意的生活。

sentences.english: I stick around hoping to meet more talkative mourners.
sentences.chinese: 我驻足四顾，希望和更多的悼唁者交流。

sentences.english: The press was gathering in front, looking around.
sentences.chinese: 新闻界人士已经聚集在前面，引颈四顾。

definition: to look around/to peep (through a crack)/to peer at/to throw a look at
to run one's eyes over/to sweep one's eyes over
to draw back/to move back and forth/to hesitate/in an instant
overwhelmed with shock, horror or amazement/dumbstruck/aghast
